source: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi - Tafhim al-Qur'an - The Meaning of the Quran
short_text: The Surah takes its name from the word al-waqi`ah of the very first verse.
text:
The Surah takes its name from the word al-waqi\`ah of the very first verse.

Period of Revelation

According to the chronological order that Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas has given of the Surahs, first Surah Ta Ha was sent down, then Al-Waqi'ah and then Ash-Shu\`ara'(Suyuti: Al-Itqan). The same sequence has been reported from Ikrimah (Baihaqi: Dala'il an Nubuwwat).

This is supported also by the story that Ibn Hisham has related from Ibn Ishaq about the affirmation of the Faith by Hadrat Umar (may Allah be pleased with him). It says that when Hadarat Umar entered his sister's house, Surah Ta Ha was being recited. Hearing his voice the people of the house hid the pages of the Qur'an. Hadrat Umar first seized his brother-in-law and then his sister rose in defense of her husband, he hit her also and wounded her on the head. When Umar saw blood on his sister, he was sorry for what he had done, and said to her: "Show me the manuscript that you have concealed so that I may see what it contains." The sister said: "You are unclean because of your polytheism: wa anna-hu la yamassu-ha ill-at-tahir : "Only a clean person can touch it." So, Hadrat Umar rose and washed himself, and then took up the manuscript to read it. This shows that Surah Al-Waqi'ah had been sent down by that time for it contains the verse: La yamassu hu ill al
mutahharun ; and it had been established historically that Hadrat Umar embraced Islam after the first migration to Habash, in the fifth year of the Prophethood.

Theme and Subject Matter

Its theme is the Hereafter, Tauhid and refutation of the Makkan disbelievers' suspicions about the Qur'an. What they regarded as utterly incredible was that Resurrection would ever take place, then the entire system of the earth and heavens would be upset, and when all the dead would be resurrected and called to account, after which the righteous would be admitted to Paradise and the wicked cast into Hell. They regarded all this as imaginary, which could not possibly happen in actual fact. In answer to this, it was said: "When the inevitable event will take place, there will be none to belie its happening, nor will anyone have the Power to avert it, nor prove it to, be an unreal happening. At that time all peoples will be divided into three classes: (1) The foremost in rank and position; (2) the common righteous people and (3) those who denied the Hereafter and persisted in disbelief and polytheism and major sins till the last." How these three classes of the people will
be rewarded and punished has been described in detail in vv. 7-56.

Then, in vv. 57-74 arguments have been given, one after the other, to prove the truth of the two basic doctrines of Islam, which the disbelievers were refusing to accept, viz. the doctrines of Tauhid and the Hereafter. In these arguments, apart from every thing else that exists in the earth and heavens, man's attention has been drawn to his own body and to the food that he eats and to the water that he drinks and to the fire on which he cooks his food, and he has been invited to ponder the question : What right do you have to behave independently of, or serve any other than, the God Whose creative power has brought you into being, and Whose provisions sustain you And how can you entertain the idea that after having once brought you into existence He has become so helpless and powerless that He cannot recreate you once again even if he wills to?

Then, in vv. 75-82 their suspicions in respect of the Qur'an have been refuted and they have been made to realize how fortunate they are that instead of deriving any benefit from the great blessing that the Qur'an is, they are treating it with scant attention and have set only this share of theirs in it that they deny it. If one seriously considers this matchless argument that has been presented in two brief sentences about the truth of the Qur'an, one will find in it the same kind of firm and stable system as exists among the stars and planets of the Universe, and the same is the proof of the fact that its Author is the same Being Who has created the Universe. Then the disbelievers have been told that this Book is inscribed in that Writ of Destiny which is beyond the reach of the creatures, as if to say "You think it is brought down by the devils to Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), whereas none but the pure angels has any access to the means by which it
reaches Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) from the well guarded Tablet."

In conclusion, man has been warned, as if to say: "You may brad and boast as you like and may shut your eyes to the truths in your arrogance of independence, but death is enough to open your eyes. At death you become helpless: you cannot save your own parents; you cannot save your children; you cannot save your religious guided and beloved leaders. They all die in front of your vary eyes while you look on helplessly. If there is no supreme power ruling over you, and your this assumption is correct that you are all in all in the world, and there is no God, then why don't you restore to the dying person his soul?Just as you are helpless in this, so it is also beyond your power to stop Allah from calling the people to account and mete out rewards and punishments to them. You may or may not believe it, but every dying person will surely see his own end after death. If he belongs to those nearest to God, he will see the good end meant for them if he be from among the righteous, he
will see the end prepared for the righteous; and if he be from among the deniers of the truth, he will see the end destined for the criminals.
description: The surah that opens by naming the occurrence of the end of time with the title, The Imminent; for all who deny that it is coming will never belie it when finally it happens. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions “the Imminent Hour” (al-wāqiʿah) i.e., the Day og Resurrection. The surah whose central message is stated in its opening verses: the Day of Judgement is inevitable and it will sort people into the humiliated and the richly rewarded. As in the previous surah, people are divided into three classes: those brought near to God (the best of the believers), those on the right (the ordinary believers), and those on the left (the disbelievers). Ample proof is given of God’s power and consequently His ability to bring about the Resurrection (verse 57 .).The surah is also known as That Which is Coming, The Indisputable Event, The Inevitable, The Inevitable Event, The Occurrence, The Terror

Efendi Nahi.verse 56:1: Kur të ndodhë Ngjarja (Dita e Kijametit), -
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:2: të ndodhurit e saj askush nuk do ta mohojë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:3: e cila i ulë (të këqinjtë), i lartëson (të mirët),
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:6: dhe shndërrohen në pluhur të shpërndarë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:7: kur ju njerëzit, do të ndaheni në tri grupe:
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:8: ata të lumturit – kush janë të lumturit?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:9: dhe ata fatkëqinjtë – kush janë fatkëqinjtë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:10: Ata që kanë prirë (në besim), do të prijnë (edhe në xhennet),
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:12: në kopshtet e xhennetit e të kënaqësisë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:13: (e këta janë) shumë prej të parëve,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:15: në divanet e stolisura (me gurë të çmueshëm),
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:16: të mbështetur në to dhe të kthyer njëri karshi tjetrit;
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:17: do t’u sillen rreth tyre (për t’ju shërbyer) djelmoshat përherë të rinj,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:18: me kupa, ibrikë dhe shishe (pijesh) prej burimit rrjedhës,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:19: prej të cilit nuk do t’u dhembë koka dhe nuk do t’u humbë mendja, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:20: dhe pemë të cilat do t’i zgjedhin vetë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:21: dhe mish të shpendëve çfarë ju ka ënda.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:22: Në to (xhennete) ka edhe hyrie (të bukura) sy-mëdha,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:24: shpërblim për atë që kanë punuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:25: Në ta nuk do të dëgjojnë biseda të kota as fjalë mëkatësh,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:27: E, ata të lumturit – kush janë të lumturit?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:28: Do të gjenden në mes lotusve (lloj druri) pa gjemba,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:29: dhe babanave të mbushura me frute
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:33: të cilat kurrë nuk sosen, as nuk janë të ndaluara (për t’i marrë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:34: dhe në shtrojet e ngritura (bashkëshorte virtytesh të larta).
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:35: Ne i kemi krijuar ato në formë të re,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:36: dhe i kemi bërë ato virxhëresha,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:37: të dashura për bashkëshortët e tyre dhe moshatare me ta –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:39: (këta – të mirët) janë shumë prej (popujve) të lashtëve
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:40: e shumë edhe prej të mëvonshmëve.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:41: E, ata fatkëqinjtë – cilët janë fatkëqinjtë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:42: Ata (që) do të jenë në frymën e zjarrit dhe të ujit të vëluar
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:43: dhe në hijen e tymit të zi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:44: në të cilën nuk do të ketë freski as kurrfarë të mire.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:45: Ata, para kësaj (në këtë botë), kanë jetuar në luks,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:46: dhe me këmbëngulje bënin mëkate të rënda,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:47: dhe thonin: “Vallë, pasi të vdesim e të bëhemi tokë e eshtra, a, me të vërtetë, do të ringjallemi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:48: vallë, edhe të parët tonë të lashtë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:49: Thuaju (o Muhammed!): “Me të vërtetë, edhe të parët edhe të mbramët, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:50: do të tubohen në një kohë (të caktuar), të ditës së njohur,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:51: dhe, atëherë ju, o të humbur, që përgënjeshtroni ringjalljen,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:52: me siguri do të hani nga druri i zekkumit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:53: dhe me te do të mbushni stomakun,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:54: e pastaj në të, do të pini ujë të vëluar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:55: dhe do të pini ashtu siç pin devja e etshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:56: kjo (që u përmend) do të jetë pozita e tyre në Ditën e Kijametit!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:57: Ne, u krijuam juve – e, sikur të kishit besuar!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:58: A po shihni ju farën (spermën) që e hedhni (injektoni)
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:59: a po e krijoni (dhe zhvilloni njeriun ju), apo Ne jemi krijues?
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:60: Ne e caktojmë vdekjen tuaj dhe askush nuk mund të na pengojë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:61: që t’ju ndryshojmë figurën tuaj dhe t’ju krijojmë në figurën çfarë ju nuk e dini.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:62: Ju, madje, e dini krijimin e parë, e pse nuk po këshilloheni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:63: A shihni atë që po e mbillni?
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:64: A mos ju jepni, që prej saj të mbijë (bima), apo Ne japim që të mbijë ajo?
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:65: Nëse duam Ne, Ne do ta thërrmojmë atë (bimën) dhe ju do të çuditeni,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:66: (dhe, do të thoni): “Ne, me të vërtetë, jemi të dëmtuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:68: A po e shihni (atë) ujë që e pini –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:69: a mos e lëshoni ju prej réve apo Ne e lëshojmë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:70: Nëse duam Ne, Ne do ta bëjmë atë të njelmët – e përse nuk falenderoheni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:71: A po e shihni atë zjarr, që e ndezni –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:72: a mos e keni bërë ju drurin e saj, apo Ne e kemi bërë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:73: Ne, e kemi bërë zjarrin përkujtues (të zjarrit të skëterrës) dhe që t’u sjellë dobi nevojtarëve,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:74: andaj lavdëroje emrin e Zotit tënd të Madhërueshëm!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:75: Dhe, betohu në çastin e perëndimit të yjeve,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:76: e ky është, betim i madh, nëse e dini, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:77: ky (shpjeguesi i këtyre), është, me të vërtetë, Kur’ani i nderuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:79: le ta prekin atë vetëm të pastërtit –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:80: (ai është) Shpallje prej Zotit të Gjithësisë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:81: E, vallë, ju këtë fjalë (Kur’anin) nuk e përfillni?
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:82: dhe, në vend të mirënjohjes për furnizimin e dhuruar, që u është dhënë – ju, në të vërtetë, po e përgënjeshtroni atë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:83: E, përse kur t’ju vie shpirti në fyt,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:84: dhe kur ju atëherë e shikoni atë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:85: e ne jemi më afër atij se ju, por ju nuk shihni, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:86: e sikur të ishit ju të fuqishëm (e nuk sundon tjetërkush)
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:87: atëherë do t’ia kthenit (shpirtin atij), nëse thoni të vërtetën?
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:88: Dhe, nëse është (ai që është në agoni) nga ata që janë afër te Perëndia –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:89: (për te ka) komoditet, mëshirë dhe furnizim të madh dhe kopshtet e dhuntive!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:90: E, nëse është (ai që është në agoni) nga të lumturit –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:91: e, përshëndetje për ty nga ata që janë të lumtur!
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:92: E, nëse është (ai që është në agoni) nga ata që kanë përgënjeshtruar – të humburve –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:93: ata do të gostiten me ujë të vëluar –
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:94: dhe përcëllim në zjarr të xhehennemit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:95: Në të vërtetë, e gjithë kjo, është e vërtetë e saktë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 56:96: Andaj lavdëroje emrin e Zotit tënd të Madhërueshëm! saktë.

null.verse 56:2: Onun vaqe olmasını heç kəs təkzib edə (dana) bilməz!
null.verse 56:3: O (kimini) alçaldacaq, (kimini də) ucaldacaqdır.
null.verse 56:4: Yer hərəkətə gəlib şiddətlə titrədiyi,
null.verse 56:5: Dağlar parça-parça olub ovxalandığı
null.verse 56:6: Və toz kimi səpələndiyi zaman
null.verse 56:7: Siz (ey insanlar!) üç zümrəyə ayrılacaqsınız:
null.verse 56:8: Sağ tərəf sahibləri (əməl dətərləri sağ əllərinə verilənlər).
null.verse 56:9: Sol tərəf sahibləri (əməl dətərləri sol əllərinə verilənlər).
null.verse 56:10: Və öndə olanlar.
null.verse 56:11: Onlar (Allah dərgahına, Allahın lütfünə) yaxınlaşdırılmış kimsələrdir.
null.verse 56:14: Biz azı da axırıncılardandır (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlamın ümmətindəndir).
null.verse 56:15: (Onlar qızıl-gümüş, lə'l-cavahiratla) bəzənmiş taxtlar üstündə qərar tutacaq,
null.verse 56:16: Onlara (o taxtlara) söykənib bir-biri ilə qarşı-qarşıya əyləşəcəklər.
null.verse 56:17: Onların dövrəsində həmişəcavan xidmətçi oğlanlar dolanacaqlar;
null.verse 56:18: (Cənnət bulağından axan) məin (şərab) dolu piyalələr, kuzələr və qədəhlərlə.
null.verse 56:19: (Dünyadakı şərabdan fərqli olaraq) ondan başları ağrımaz və keflənməzlər.
null.verse 56:20: (O cavan xidmətçilər Cənnətdə olanların) bəyənib seçdikləri meyvələr
null.verse 56:21: Və istədikləri hər cür quş əti ilə (onların dövrəsində fırlanacaqlar).
null.verse 56:22: (Onlar üçün orada) iri (ahu) gözlü, qəşəng hurilər də vardır.
null.verse 56:23: (O hurilər rəng və gözəllikcə) sanki sədəf içində gizlənmiş (qorunub-saxlanmış) incidirlər.
null.verse 56:24: Onlar (bu ne'mətlərə dünyada) etdikləri (yaxşı) əməllər müqabilində nail olacaqlar.
null.verse 56:25: Onlar orada (Cənnətdə) nə boş söz, nə də günaha bais olan bir şey eşidəcəklər.
null.verse 56:27: Sağ tərəf sahibləri! (Əməl dəftərləri sağ əllərində olanlar!) Kimdir o sağ tərəf sahibləri?
null.verse 56:28: (Onlar) tikansız sidr ağacları,
null.verse 56:33: Tükənməz və qadağan edilməyən (meyvələr) içində
null.verse 56:34: Və (bir-birinin üstünə yığılmış) hündür döşəklər üstündə (yaxud yüksək əxlaq və qeyri-adi gözəllik sahibi olan qadınlar yanında) olacaqlar!
null.verse 56:35: Şübhəsiz ki, Biz onları (huriləri) başqa cür (yeni bir yaradılışla, doğulmadan) yaradacağıq!
null.verse 56:38: Sağ tərəf sahibləri (əməl dəftəri sağ əllərinə verilənlər) üçündür onlar!
null.verse 56:39: (Onların) bir çoxu əvvəlkilərdən (keçmiş peyğəmbərlərin ümmətlərindən),
null.verse 56:41: Sol tərəf sahibləri! (Əməl dəftərləri sol əllərinə verilənlər!) Kimdir o sol tərəf sahibləri?
null.verse 56:42: (Onlar) səmum yeli (qızmar atəş) və qaynar su içində,
null.verse 56:44: (O kölgə başqa kölgələrdən fərqli olaraq) nə sərin, nə də xoşagələndir.
null.verse 56:45: Onlar bundan əvvəl (dünyada) naz-ne'mət içində idilər.
null.verse 56:46: ?zləri də böyük günah içində (Allaha şərik qoşmaqla) israr edib dururdular.
null.verse 56:47: Və belə deyirdilər: "Əcaba, biz öldükdən, toz-torpaq və sür-sümük olduqdan sonra, həqiqətən, yenidən dirildiləcəyikmi?!
null.verse 56:48: Yaxud bizdən əvvəl gəlib-getmiş atalarımız da dirildiləcəklərmi?!"
null.verse 56:49: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) De: "(Sizdən) əvvəlkilər də, sonrakılar da,
null.verse 56:50: Mə'lum bir günün (qiyamət gününün) müəyyən bir vaxtında mütləq (məhşərə) cəm ediləcəklər.
null.verse 56:51: Sonra, siz ey (haqq) yoldan azanlar, (haqqı) dananlar!
null.verse 56:52: Şübhəsiz ki, zəqqum ağacından (onun meyvəsindən) yeyəcəksiniz,
null.verse 56:53: Qarınlarınızı onunla dolduracaqsınız.
null.verse 56:54: Ustündən də (sizə bərk yanğı gəldiyi üçün) qaynar su içəcəksiniz.
null.verse 56:55: ?zü də onu susuzluq xəstəliyinə tutulmuş (dəvə) kimi içəcəksiniz.
null.verse 56:56: Bu onların haqq-hesab günündəki ziyafətidir.
null.verse 56:57: (Ey kafirlər!) Biz sizi (yoxdan) yaratdıq.
null.verse 56:58: Bəs (bətnlərə) axıtdığınız nütfəyə nə deyirsiniz?
null.verse 56:59: Ondan (insan) yaradan sizsiniz, yoxsa Biz?!
null.verse 56:60: Sizin aranızda ölüm (kimin nə vaxt öləcəyini) əvvəlcədən Biz müəyyən etdik.
null.verse 56:61: (Sizi yox edib) yerinizə sizin kimiləri gətirməkdən (sizi başqaları ilə əvəz etməkdən) və sizi özünüz də bilmədiyiniz başqa bir şəkildə yaratmaqdan!
null.verse 56:62: And olsun ki, siz ilk yaradılış (dünyaya necə gəldiyinizi) bilirsiniz.
null.verse 56:63: Bəs əkdiyiniz (toxuma) nə deyirsiniz?
null.verse 56:64: Onu bitirən sizsiniz, yoxsa Biz?!
null.verse 56:65: Əgər Biz istəsəydik, onu bir saman çöpünə döndərər, siz də mat-məətəl qalıb:
null.verse 56:67: Bəlkə, (hələ ruzidən də) məhrum olmuş kimsələrik!" (deyərdiniz).
null.verse 56:68: Bəs içdiyiniz suya nə deyirsiniz?
null.verse 56:69: Onu buluddan endirən sizsiniz, yoxsa Biz?!
null.verse 56:70: Əgər istəsəydik, onu acı (bir su) edərdik.
null.verse 56:71: Bəs (yaş ağacdan) yandırdığınız oda nə deyirsiniz?
null.verse 56:72: Onun ağacını yaradan sizsiniz, yoxsa Biz?
null.verse 56:73: Biz onu (sizi cəhənnəm odu ilə qorxutmaqdan ötrü) ibrət dərsi və səhrada olan müsafirlərin faydalanması üçün yaratdıq.
null.verse 56:74: Belə olduqda (ya Peyğəmbər!) sən ulu olan Rəbbinin adını müqəddəs tutub zikr et!
null.verse 56:75: Ulduzların (bürclərdəki) mənzillərinə (yaxud doğub-batdığı yerlərə) and olsun ki -
null.verse 56:76: Kaş bunun nə qədər böyük bir and olduğunu biləydiniz -
null.verse 56:78: (O, Allah dərgahında) qorunub saxlanılan bir Kitabdadır (lövhi-məhfuzdadır, yaxud lülələnib bükülmüş kağızlardadır).
null.verse 56:79: Ona yalnız pak olanlar toxuna bilər!
null.verse 56:80: (O) Aləmlərin Rəbbi tərəfindən nazil edilmişdir.
null.verse 56:81: İndi siz bu kəlamı yalan sayırsınız? (Bu sözümə məhəl qoymursunuz?)
null.verse 56:82: Ruzinizə şükür etməli olduğunuz halda, onu yalanmı hesab edirsiniz?
null.verse 56:83: (Can) boğaza yetişdiyi (ölüm gəlib çatdığı) zaman
null.verse 56:84: Siz (ona) baxıb durursunuz (əlinizdən heç bir şey gəlmir).
null.verse 56:85: Biz ona sizdən daha yaxınıq, amma siz (bunu) görmürsünüz!
null.verse 56:86: Əgər sizdən (dediyiniz kimi, qiyamət günü əməllərinizə görə) haqq-hesab çəkilməyəcəksə,
null.verse 56:87: Və əgər ("öləndən sonra heç bir dirilmə, haqq-hesab yoxdur" sözünü) doğru deyirsinizsə, bəlkə, (o çıxan canı) geri (bədənə) qaytarasınız?!
null.verse 56:88: Amma əgər (ölən kimsə Allah dərgahına, Allahın lütf və mərhəmətinə) yaxın olanlardandırsa,
null.verse 56:89: (Onu) rəhmət, gözəl ruzi (yaxud xoş ətirli çiçəklər) və Nəim cənnəti gözləyir!
null.verse 56:90: Əgər o, sağ tərəf sahiblərindəndirsə (əməl dəftəri sağ əlinə verilənlərdəndirsə),
null.verse 56:91: (Ona özü kimi olan yoldaşlarının dili ilə: ) "Sağ tərəf sahiblərindən sənə salam olsun!" (deyiləcəkdir).
null.verse 56:92: Əgər (ölən kimsə Allahın ayələrini, mö'cüzələrini) yalan sayanlardan və yoldan azanlardandırsa,
null.verse 56:93: (Ona) qaynar su ziyafəti veriləcək
null.verse 56:95: Şübhəsiz ki, bu, təkzibolunmaz həqiqətdir!
null.verse 56:96: Elə isə (ya Peyğəmbər!) sən ulu olan Rəbbinin adını təsbih (müqəddəs turub zikr) et! (Və ya: Sən Rəbbini o böyük adı ilə təsbih et!)

null.verse 56:2: događanje njegovo niko neće poricati -
null.verse 56:3: neke će poniziti, a neke uzvisiti;
null.verse 56:4: kad se Zemlja jako potrese
null.verse 56:5: i brda se u komadiće zdrobe,
null.verse 56:6: i postanu prašina razasuta,
null.verse 56:7: vas će tri vrste biti:
null.verse 56:8: oni sretni - ko su sretni?!
null.verse 56:9: i oni nesretni - ko su nesretni?!
null.verse 56:10: i oni prvi - uvijek prvi!
null.verse 56:13: biće ih mnogo od naroda drevnih,
null.verse 56:15: na divanima izvezenim,
null.verse 56:16: jedni prema drugima na njima će naslonjeni biti;
null.verse 56:17: služiće ih vječno mladi mladići,
null.verse 56:18: sa čašama i ibricima i peharom punim pića iz izvora tekućeg -
null.verse 56:19: od koga ih glava neće boljeti i zbog kojeg neće pamet izgubiti -
null.verse 56:20: i voćem koje će sami birati,
null.verse 56:21: i mesom ptičijim kakvo budu željeli.
null.verse 56:22: U njima će biti i hurije očiju krupnih,
null.verse 56:24: kao nagrada za ono što su činili.
null.verse 56:25: U njima neće slušati prazne besjede ni govor grješni,
null.verse 56:27: A oni sretni - ko su sretni?!
null.verse 56:28: Biće među lotosovim drvećem bez bodlji,
null.verse 56:33: kojeg će uvijek imati i koje neće zabranjeno biti,
null.verse 56:35: Stvaranjem novim Mi ćemo hurije stvoriti
null.verse 56:37: milim muževima njihovim, i godina istih
null.verse 56:39: biće ih mnogo od naroda drevnih,
null.verse 56:41: A oni nesretni - ko su nesretni?!
null.verse 56:42: Oni će biti u vatri užarenoj i vodi ključaloj
null.verse 56:44: u kojoj neće biti svježine ni ikakve dobrine.
null.verse 56:45: Oni su prije toga raskošnim životom živjeli
null.verse 56:46: i uporno teške grijehe činili
null.verse 56:47: i govorili: "Zar kada umremo i zemlje i kosti postanemo - zar ćemo zbilja biti oživljeni,
null.verse 56:49: Reci: "I drevni i kasniji,
null.verse 56:50: u određeno vrijeme, jednog određenog dana biće sakupljeni,
null.verse 56:51: i tada ćete vi, o zabludjeli, koji poričete oživljenje,
null.verse 56:52: sigurno, s drveta Zekkum jesti,
null.verse 56:53: i njime ćete trbuhe puniti,
null.verse 56:54: pa zatim na to ključalu vodu piti,
null.verse 56:55: poput kamila koje ne mogu žeđ ugasiti;
null.verse 56:56: to će na onome svijetu biti gošćenje njihovo!
null.verse 56:57: Mi vas stvaramo - pa zašto ne povjerujete?
null.verse 56:58: Kažite vi Meni: da li sjemenu koje ubacujete
null.verse 56:59: vi oblik dajete ili Mi to činimo?
null.verse 56:60: Mi određujemo kada će ko od vas umrijeti, i niko nas ne može spriječiti
null.verse 56:61: da likove vaše izmijenimo i da vas iznova u likovima koje vi ne poznajete stvorimo.
null.verse 56:62: Poznato vam je kako ste prvi put stvoreni, pa zašto se ne urazumite?
null.verse 56:63: Kažite vi Meni: šta biva sa onim što posijete?
null.verse 56:64: Da li mu vi dajete snagu da niče, ili to Mi činimo?
null.verse 56:65: Ako hoćemo možemo ga u suho rastinje pretvoriti, pa biste se snebivali:
null.verse 56:67: čak smo svega lišeni!"
null.verse 56:68: Kažite vi Meni: vodu koju pijete -
null.verse 56:69: da li je vi ili Mi iz oblaka spuštamo?
null.verse 56:70: Ako želimo, možemo je slanom učiniti - pa zašto niste zahvalni?
null.verse 56:71: Kažite vi Meni: vatru koju palite -
null.verse 56:72: da li drvo za nju vi ili Mi stvaramo?
null.verse 56:73: Mi činimo da ona podsjeća i da bude korisna onima koji konače;
null.verse 56:74: zato hvali Gospodara svoga Veličanstvenog!
null.verse 56:75: I kunem se časom kad se zvijezde gube,
null.verse 56:76: a to je, da znate, zakletva velika,
null.verse 56:79: dodirnuti ga smiju samo oni koji su čisti,
null.verse 56:80: on je Objava od Gospodara svjetova.
null.verse 56:81: Pa, kako ovaj govor omalovažavate
null.verse 56:82: i umjesto zahvalnosti što vam je hrana darovana - vi u njega ne vjerujete?
null.verse 56:83: a zašto vi kad duša do guše dopre,
null.verse 56:84: i kad vi budete tada gledali,
null.verse 56:85: a Mi smo mu bliži od vas, ali vi ne vidite,
null.verse 56:86: zašto je onda kad niste u tuđoj vlasti
null.verse 56:87: ne povratite, ako istinu govorite?
null.verse 56:88: I ako bude jedan od onih koji su Allahu bliski -
null.verse 56:89: udobnost i opskrba lijepa i džennetske blagodati njemu!
null.verse 56:90: A ako bude jedan od onih koji su sretni -
null.verse 56:91: pa, pozdrav tebi od onih koji su sretni!
null.verse 56:92: A ako bude jedan od onih koji su poricali i u zabludi ostali,
null.verse 56:93: pa, ključalom vodom biće ugošćen
null.verse 56:95: Sama je istina, zbilja, sve ovo -
null.verse 56:96: zato hvali ime Gospodara svoga Veličanstvenog! -

null.verse 56:2: যার বাস্তবতায় কোন সংশয় নেই।
null.verse 56:3: এটা নীচু করে দেবে, সমুন্নত করে দেবে।
null.verse 56:4: যখন প্রবলভাবে প্রকম্পিত হবে পৃথিবী।
null.verse 56:5: এবং পর্বতমালা ভেঙ্গে চুরমার হয়ে যাবে।
null.verse 56:6: অতঃপর তা হয়ে যাবে উৎক্ষিপ্ত ধূলিকণা।
null.verse 56:7: এবং তোমরা তিনভাবে বিভক্ত হয়ে পড়বে।
null.verse 56:8: যারা ডান দিকে, কত ভাগ্যবান তারা।
null.verse 56:9: এবং যারা বামদিকে, কত হতভাগা তারা।
null.verse 56:10: অগ্রবর্তীগণ তো অগ্রবর্তীই।
null.verse 56:15: স্বর্ণ খচিত সিংহাসন।
null.verse 56:16: তারা তাতে হেলান দিয়ে বসবে পরস্পর মুখোমুখি হয়ে।
null.verse 56:17: তাদের কাছে ঘোরাফেরা করবে চির কিশোরেরা।
null.verse 56:18: পানপাত্র কুঁজা ও খাঁটি সূরাপূর্ণ পেয়ালা হাতে নিয়ে,
null.verse 56:19: যা পান করলে তাদের শিরঃপীড়া হবে না এবং বিকারগ্রস্ত ও হবে না।
null.verse 56:20: আর তাদের পছন্দমত ফল-মুল নিয়ে,
null.verse 56:21: এবং রুচিমত পাখীর মাংস নিয়ে।
null.verse 56:22: তথায় থাকবে আনতনয়না হুরগণ,
null.verse 56:24: তারা যা কিছু করত, তার পুরস্কারস্বরূপ।
null.verse 56:25: তারা তথায় অবান্তর ও কোন খারাপ কথা শুনবে না।
null.verse 56:27: যারা ডান দিকে থাকবে, তারা কত ভাগ্যবান।
null.verse 56:28: তারা থাকবে কাঁটাবিহীন বদরিকা বৃক্ষে।
null.verse 56:33: যা শেষ হবার নয় এবং নিষিদ্ধ ও নয়,
null.verse 56:35: আমি জান্নাতী রমণীগণকে বিশেষরূপে সৃষ্টি করেছি।
null.verse 56:39: তাদের একদল হবে পূর্ববর্তীদের মধ্য থেকে।
null.verse 56:41: বামপার্শ্বস্থ লোক, কত না হতভাগা তারা।
null.verse 56:42: তারা থাকবে প্রখর বাষ্পে এবং উত্তপ্ত পানিতে,
null.verse 56:44: যা শীতল নয় এবং আরামদায়কও নয়।
null.verse 56:45: তারা ইতিপূর্বে স্বাচ্ছন্দ্যশীল ছিল।
null.verse 56:46: তারা সদাসর্বদা ঘোরতর পাপকর্মে ডুবে থাকত।
null.verse 56:47: তারা বলতঃ আমরা যখন মরে অস্থি ও মৃত্তিকায় পরিণত হয়ে যাব, তখনও কি পুনরুত্থিত হব?
null.verse 56:49: বলুনঃ পূর্ববর্তী ও পরবর্তীগণ,
null.verse 56:50: সবাই একত্রিত হবে এক নির্দিষ্ট দিনের নির্দিষ্ট সময়ে।
null.verse 56:51: অতঃপর হে পথভ্রষ্ট, মিথ্যারোপকারীগণ।
null.verse 56:52: তোমরা অবশ্যই ভক্ষণ করবে যাক্কুম বৃক্ষ থেকে,
null.verse 56:53: অতঃপর তা দ্বারা উদর পূর্ণ করবে,
null.verse 56:54: অতঃপর তার উপর পান করবে উত্তপ্ত পানি।
null.verse 56:55: পান করবে পিপাসিত উটের ন্যায়।
null.verse 56:56: কেয়ামতের দিন এটাই হবে তাদের আপ্যায়ন।
null.verse 56:57: আমি সৃষ্টি করেছি তোমাদেরকে। অতঃপর কেন তোমরা তা সত্য বলে বিশ্বাস কর না।
null.verse 56:58: তোমরা কি ভেবে দেখেছ, তোমাদের বীর্যপাত সম্পর্কে।
null.verse 56:59: তোমরা তাকে সৃষ্টি কর, না আমি সৃষ্টি করি?
null.verse 56:60: আমি তোমাদের মৃত্যুকাল নির্ধারিত করেছি এবং আমি অক্ষম নই।
null.verse 56:61: এ ব্যাপারে যে, তোমাদের পরিবর্তে তোমাদের মত লোককে নিয়ে আসি এবং তোমাদেরকে এমন করে দেই, যা তোমরা জান না।
null.verse 56:62: তোমরা অবগত হয়েছ প্রথম সৃষ্টি সম্পর্কে, তবে তোমরা অনুধাবন কর না কেন?
null.verse 56:63: তোমরা যে বীজ বপন কর, সে সম্পর্কে ভেবে দেখেছ কি?
null.verse 56:64: তোমরা তাকে উৎপন্ন কর, না আমি উৎপন্নকারী ?
null.verse 56:65: আমি ইচ্ছা করলে তাকে খড়কুটা করে দিতে পারি, অতঃপর হয়ে যাবে তোমরা বিস্ময়াবিষ্ট।
null.verse 56:66: বলবেঃ আমরা তো ঋণের চাপে পড়ে গেলাম;
null.verse 56:67: বরং আমরা হূত সর্বস্ব হয়ে পড়লাম।
null.verse 56:68: তোমরা যে পানি পান কর, সে সম্পর্কে ভেবে দেখেছ কি?
null.verse 56:69: তোমরা তা মেঘ থেকে নামিয়ে আন, না আমি বর্ষন করি?
null.verse 56:70: আমি ইচ্ছা করলে তাকে লোনা করে দিতে পারি, অতঃপর তোমরা কেন কৃতজ্ঞতা প্রকাশ কর না?
null.verse 56:71: তোমরা যে অগ্নি প্রজ্জ্বলিত কর, সে সম্পর্কে ভেবে দেখেছ কি?
null.verse 56:72: তোমরা কি এর বৃক্ষ সৃষ্টি করেছ, না আমি সৃষ্টি করেছি ?
null.verse 56:73: আমি সেই বৃক্ষকে করেছি স্মরণিকা এবং মরুবাসীদের জন্য সামগ্রী।
null.verse 56:74: অতএব, আপনি আপনার মহান পালনকর্তার নামে পবিত্রতা ঘোষণা করুন।
null.verse 56:75: অতএব, আমি তারকারাজির অস্তাচলের শপথ করছি,
null.verse 56:76: নিশ্চয় এটা এক মহা শপথ-যদি তোমরা জানতে।
null.verse 56:79: যারা পাক-পবিত্র, তারা ব্যতীত অন্য কেউ একে স্পর্শ করবে না।
null.verse 56:80: এটা বিশ্ব-পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে অবতীর্ণ।
null.verse 56:81: তবুও কি তোমরা এই বাণীর প্রতি শৈথিল্য পদর্শন করবে?
null.verse 56:82: এবং একে মিথ্যা বলাকেই তোমরা তোমাদের ভূমিকায় পরিণত করবে?
null.verse 56:83: অতঃপর যখন কারও প্রাণ কন্ঠাগত হয়।
null.verse 56:84: এবং তোমরা তাকিয়ে থাক,
null.verse 56:85: তখন আমি তোমাদের অপেক্ষা তার অধিক নিকটে থাকি; কিন্তু তোমরা দেখ না।
null.verse 56:86: যদি তোমাদের হিসাব-কিতাব না হওয়াই ঠিক হয়,
null.verse 56:87: তবে তোমরা এই আত্মাকে ফিরাও না কেন, যদি তোমরা সত্যবাদী হও ?
null.verse 56:88: যদি সে নৈকট্যশীলদের একজন হয়;
null.verse 56:89: তবে তার জন্যে আছে সুখ, উত্তম রিযিক এবং নেয়ামতে ভরা উদ্যান।
null.verse 56:90: আর যদি সে ডান পার্শ্বস্থদের একজন হয়,
null.verse 56:91: তবে তাকে বলা হবেঃ তোমার জন্যে ডানপার্শ্বসস্থদের পক্ষ থেকে সালাম।
null.verse 56:92: আর যদি সে পথভ্রষ্ট মিথ্যারোপকারীদের একজন হয়,
null.verse 56:93: তবে তার আপ্যায়ন হবে উত্তপ্ত পানি দ্বারা।
null.verse 56:95: এটা ধ্রুব সত্য।
null.verse 56:96: অতএব, আপনি আপনার মহান পালনকর্তার নামে পবিত্রতা ঘোষণা করুন। সত্য।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:2: никой не ще възпре неговото настъпване -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:4: Когато земята се разтърси в трус
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:5: и планините се разломят на отломки,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:7: вие ще станете на три групи:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:8: едни - отдясно, - какво ще е за тези отдясно?;
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:9: и други - отляво, - какво ще е за тези отляво?;
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:10: и първенците [в богобоязливостта], - те са първенците [в Рая]
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:20: Не ще ги боли глава от това и не ще губят ум.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:23: И ще имат хубавици с големи очи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:26: Не ще слушат там нито празнословие, нито подбуда към грях,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:44: Сред изгарящ вятър и вряща вода,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:47: Те живееха сред разкош преди това.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:49: И казваха: Нима като умрем и станем пръст и кости, нима наистина ще бъдем възкресени?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:50: А нима и древните ни предци?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:52: наистина ще бъдат събрани по време на знайния Ден.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:54: наистина ще ядете от дървото Зокум
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:55: и ще си пълните от него стомасите,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:56: и ще пиете след това от врящата вода.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:57: Ще пиете, както пият прежаднелите камили.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:58: Това е угощението им в Съдния ден.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:60: Не виждате ли семето, което изливате?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:61: Вие ли го сътворявате, или Ние сме Твореца?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:62: Ние отредихме смъртта за вас и не ще бъдем възпрени
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:63: да променим такива като вас и да ви пресъздадем в нещо, което не ви е познато.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:65: И не виждате ли какво сеете?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:66: Вие ли го карате да расте, или Ние го караме?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:67: Ако пожелаехме, бихме го сторили на сухи съчки и щяхте да останете слисани:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:70: И не виждате ли водата, която пиете?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:71: Вие ли я изсипвате от облака или Ние я изсипваме?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:72: Ако пожелаехме, бихме я сторили солена, защо тогава не сте признателни?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:73: Не виждате ли огъня, който разпалвате?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:74: Вие ли създавате дървото за него, или Ние сме Създателя?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:75: Ние го сторихме за поучение и за ползване от онези, които се нуждаят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:76: Затова прославяй името на твоя Господ, Превеликия!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:77: Но не, кълна се в залезите на звездите -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:78: а това е клетва - ако знаете - велика,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:84: И [вместо благодарност] за препитанието вие го взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:85: И когато [душата на умиращия] стигне гърлото,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:87: а Ние сме по-близо до него от вас, ала не виждате -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:88: и защо, ако не ще бъдете съдени,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:89: не я върнете обратно, ако говорите истината?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:92: тогава - покой и удовлетворение, и Градината на блаженството.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:93: А ако е от онези отдясно,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:94: тогава [ще му се каже]: Мир на теб, защото си от онези отдясно!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:95: А ако е от отричащите, заблудените,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 56:99: Затова прославяй името на твоя Господ, Превеликия! истина.

null.verse 56:1: 當那件大事發生的時候，
null.verse 56:2: 沒有任何人否認其發生。
null.verse 56:3: 那件大事將是能使人降級，能使人升級的；
null.verse 56:4: 當大地震盪，
null.verse 56:5: 山巒粉碎，
null.verse 56:6: 化為散漫的塵埃，
null.verse 56:7: 而你們分為三等的時候。
null.verse 56:8: 幸福者，幸福者是何等的人？
null.verse 56:9: 薄命者，薄命者是何等的人？
null.verse 56:10: 最先行善者，是最先入樂園的人。
null.verse 56:11: 這等人，確是蒙主眷顧的。
null.verse 56:12: 他們將在恩澤的樂園中。
null.verse 56:15: 在珠寶鑲成的床榻上，
null.verse 56:16: 彼此相對地靠在上面。
null.verse 56:17: 長生不老的僮僕，輪流著服侍他們，
null.verse 56:18: 捧著盞和壺，與滿杯的醴泉；
null.verse 56:19: 他們不因那醴泉而頭痛，也不酩酊。
null.verse 56:20: 他們有自己所選擇的水果，
null.verse 56:21: 和自己所愛好的鳥肉。
null.verse 56:22: 還有白晢的、美目的妻子，
null.verse 56:23: 好像藏在蚌殼裡的珍珠一樣。
null.verse 56:24: 那是為了報酬他們的善行。
null.verse 56:25: 他們在樂園裡，聽不到惡言和謊話，
null.verse 56:26: 但聽到說：「祝你們平安！祝你們平安！」
null.verse 56:27: 幸福者，幸福者是何等的人？
null.verse 56:28: 他們享受無刺的酸棗樹，
null.verse 56:33: 四時不絕，可以隨意摘食；
null.verse 56:35: 我使她們重新生長，
null.verse 56:38: 這些都是幸福者所享受的。
null.verse 56:39: 他們是許多前人
null.verse 56:41: 薄命者，薄命者是何等的人？
null.verse 56:42: 他們在毒風和沸水中，
null.verse 56:44: 既不涼爽，又不美觀。
null.verse 56:45: 以前他們確是豪華的，
null.verse 56:46: 確是固執大罪的，
null.verse 56:47: 他們常說：「難道我們死後，已變成塵土和枯骨的時候，我們必定要復活嗎？
null.verse 56:48: 連我們的祖先也要復活嗎？」
null.verse 56:49: 你說：「前人和後人，
null.verse 56:50: 在一個著名的日期的特定時間必定要被集合。
null.verse 56:51: 然後迷誤的、否定復活的人們啊！
null.verse 56:52: 你們必定食欑楛木的果實，
null.verse 56:53: 而以它充饑，
null.verse 56:54: 然後痛飲沸水，
null.verse 56:55: 像害消渴病的駱駝飲涼水一樣。
null.verse 56:56: 這是他們在報應之日所受的款待。
null.verse 56:57: 我曾創造你們，你們怎不信復活呢？
null.verse 56:58: 你們告訴我吧！你們所射的精液，
null.verse 56:59: 究竟是你們把它造成人呢？還是我把他造成人呢？
null.verse 56:60: 我曾將死亡分配給你們，任何人不能阻撓我，
null.verse 56:61: 不讓我改變你們的品性，而使你們生長在你們所不知的狀態中。
null.verse 56:62: 你們確已知道初次的生長，你們怎不覺悟呢？
null.verse 56:63: 你們告訴我吧！你們所耕種的莊稼，
null.verse 56:64: 究竟是你們使它發榮呢？還是我使它發榮呢？
null.verse 56:65: 假若我意欲，我必使它凋零，而你們變成詫異者，
null.verse 56:66: 你們將說：「我們是遭損失的。
null.verse 56:67: 不然！我們是被剝奪的。」
null.verse 56:68: 你們告訴我吧！你們所飲的水，
null.verse 56:69: 究竟是你們使它從雲中降下的呢？還是我使它降下的呢？
null.verse 56:70: 假若我意欲，我必定使它變成苦的，你們怎麼不感謝呢？
null.verse 56:71: 你們告訴我吧！你們所鑽取的火，
null.verse 56:72: 究竟是你們使燧木生長的呢？還是我使它生長的呢？
null.verse 56:73: 我以它為教訓，並且以它為荒野的居民的慰藉，
null.verse 56:74: 故你們應當頌揚你的主的大名。
null.verse 56:75: 我必以星宿的沒落處盟誓，
null.verse 56:76: 這確是一個重大的盟誓，假若你們知道。
null.verse 56:79: 只有純潔者才得撫摸那經本。
null.verse 56:80: 《古蘭經》是從全世界的主降示的。
null.verse 56:81: 難道你們藐視這訓辭，
null.verse 56:82: 而以否認代替感謝嗎？
null.verse 56:83: （你們）怎麼不在靈魂到將死者的咽喉的時候——
null.verse 56:84: 那時候，你們大家看著他，
null.verse 56:85: 我比你們更臨近他，但你們不曉得，
null.verse 56:86: 如果你們不是受報應的，——
null.verse 56:87: 你們怎不使靈魂復返於本位呢？如果你們是說實話的。
null.verse 56:88: 如果他是被眷顧的，
null.verse 56:89: 那末，他將享受舒適、給養與恩澤的樂園；
null.verse 56:90: 如果他是幸福者，
null.verse 56:91: 那末，一般幸福的人將對他說：「祝你平安！」
null.verse 56:92: 如果他是迷誤的、否認復活者，
null.verse 56:93: 那末，他將享受沸水的款待，
null.verse 56:95: 這確是無可置疑的真理。
null.verse 56:96: 故你應當頌揚你的主的大名。 這確是無可置疑的真理。

null.verse 56:2: #NÁZEV?
null.verse 56:3: poníží, povýší.
null.verse 56:4: Až země zatřese se záchvěvy
null.verse 56:5: a hory na padrť budou rozdrceny
null.verse 56:6: a jako prach rozptýleny,
null.verse 56:7: rozdělíte se na tři skupiny:
null.verse 56:8: na skupinu lidí po pravici - a co bude s lidmi po pravici?
null.verse 56:9: a na skupinu lidí po levici - a co bude s lidmi po levici?
null.verse 56:10: a na předáky.
null.verse 56:11: to jsou ti, kdož (k Bohu) jsou přiblíženi,
null.verse 56:15: Na lehátkách, jež zlatem vypleteny jsou,
null.verse 56:16: jeden proti druhému odpočívat budou:
null.verse 56:17: obcházet mezi nimi budou chlapci mládí věčného
null.verse 56:18: s číšemi, konvicemi a poháry nápoje čirého,
null.verse 56:19: z něhož je hlava nerozbolí ani jím vyčerpáni nebudou,
null.verse 56:20: a s ovocem, které si volně vyberou,
null.verse 56:21: a s masem ptačím podle přání svých.
null.verse 56:22: Tam budou i dívky velkých očí černých,
null.verse 56:23: jež srovnat lze s perlami střeženými,
null.verse 56:24: odměnou za to, co vykonali na zemi.
null.verse 56:25: A neuslyší tam plané tlachání ani k hříchu svádění,
null.verse 56:26: nýbrž jen slova: "Mír, mír s vámi!"
null.verse 56:27: A lidé po pravici - co bude s lidmi po pravici?
null.verse 56:28: Ti budou mezi lotosovými stromy bezostnými
null.verse 56:33: nevyčerpatelným, nezakázaným,
null.verse 56:35: Dívky ty jsme zvláštním stvořením stvořili
null.verse 56:39: a to zástup je z prvních
null.verse 56:41: Však lidé po levici - a co bude s lidmi po levici?
null.verse 56:42: Ti budou ve větru žhavém a ve vodě vroucí,
null.verse 56:44: ani ochlazení, ani osvěžení nepřinášejícího.
null.verse 56:45: A oni si předtím žili v přepychu,
null.verse 56:46: setrvávajíce úporně ve velkém hříchu,
null.verse 56:47: a hovořili: "Zdaž až zemřeme a prachem a kostmi se staneme, budeme opravdu vzkříšeni,
null.verse 56:48: my sami a předkové naši dávní?"
null.verse 56:49: Odpověz: "Věru, první i poslední
null.verse 56:50: budou ke schůzce dne známého shromážděni!"
null.verse 56:51: A potom vskutku, vy zbloudilí, za lež prohlašující,
null.verse 56:52: ze stromu Zaqqúmu se najíte
null.verse 56:53: a břicha svá si naplníte
null.verse 56:54: a zapíjet to budete vodou vroucí
null.verse 56:55: a pít budete tak, jak chlemtají žízniví velbloudi.
null.verse 56:56: Toto v den soudný budou jejich hody!
null.verse 56:57: Jsme to My, kdo vás stvořili, proč tedy pravdu nepřiznáte?
null.verse 56:58: Což jste neuvažovali o tom, co vyměšujete?
null.verse 56:59: Stvořili jste to snad vy, anebo jsme My toho stvořiteli?
null.verse 56:60: Jsme to My, kdo smrt mezi vámi ustanovili; a nikdo nás nemůže předejít,
null.verse 56:61: abychom vás nevystřídali vám podobnými a nestvořili vás něčím, o čem potuchy nemůžete mít.
null.verse 56:62: Vždyť přece první stvoření znáte, proč si tedy nevzpomenete?
null.verse 56:63: Uvažovali jste někdy o tom, co obděláváte?
null.verse 56:64: Zaséváte to snad vy, anebo jsme My toho zasévateli?
null.verse 56:65: Kdybychom chtěli, v suchou trávu bychom to změnili, a vy byste se neustále divili:
null.verse 56:67: ba víc, teď všeho jsme zbaveni!"
null.verse 56:68: Uvažovali jste někdy o vodě, kterou pijete?
null.verse 56:69: Sesíláte ji snad vy z mraků, anebo jsme My těmi, kdož ji sesílají?
null.verse 56:70: Kdybychom chtěli, učinili bychom ji hořkou a slanou - což tedy vděčni nebudete?
null.verse 56:71: Uvažovali jste někdy o ohni, který vykřesáváte?
null.verse 56:72: Dali jste snad vy vyrůst stromu, který dřevo k tomu skýtá, anebo jsme mu My dali vyrůst?
null.verse 56:73: A učinili jsme jej připomenutím a užitkem pro ty, kteří v poušti jsou.
null.verse 56:74: Oslavuj tedy jméno Pána svého mocného!
null.verse 56:75: Hle, přísahám při hvězd západech,
null.verse 56:76: a to vskutku je přísaha - kdybyste věděli - nesmírná,
null.verse 56:77: že toto je věru Korán vznešený,
null.verse 56:79: ať dotýkají se ho jen očištění,
null.verse 56:80: od Pána lidstva je to seslání!
null.verse 56:81: Tímto vyprávěním vy opovrhujete
null.verse 56:82: a vděčnost svou tím projevujete, že za lež je prohlašujete?
null.verse 56:83: Proč tedy, až duše dostoupí do hrdla, nezasáhnete,
null.verse 56:84: zatímco k tomu přihlížíte
null.verse 56:85: - a My k tomu jsme blíže než vy, vy však Nás nevidíte.
null.verse 56:86: A nejste-li tedy dlužníky Našimi,
null.verse 56:87: navraťte ji zpět do těla, jste-li pravdomluvnými!
null.verse 56:88: Jestliže byl z přiblížených k Bohu,
null.verse 56:89: tedy mu odpočinek, vůně libá i zahrada slastí náleží,
null.verse 56:90: a jestliže z lidí po pravici byl, pak uslyší
null.verse 56:91: Mír s tebou od lidí po pravici.
null.verse 56:92: Jestliže však byl mezi popírajícími, zbloudilými,
null.verse 56:93: ve vodě vroucí nalezne pohoštění
null.verse 56:95: A věru je toto skutečnost nepochybná.
null.verse 56:96: Oslavuj tedy jméno Pána svého mocného! nepochybná.

null.verse 56:2: Zal er niets dit plaatsvinden kunnen tegenhouden -
null.verse 56:3: Enigen zal het vernederen, anderen zal het verheffen.
null.verse 56:4: Wanneer de aarde hevig zal worden geschokt,
null.verse 56:5: En de bergen verbrijzeld,
null.verse 56:6: Zullen deze als stof worden verstrooid,
null.verse 56:7: En gij zult in drie soorten worden verdeeld.
null.verse 56:8: De mensen aan de rechter kant - hoe (gelukkig zijn) de mensen aan de rechter kant!
null.verse 56:9: En de mensen aan de linker kant - hoe (ongelukkig) zijn de mensen aan de linker kant!
null.verse 56:10: De voorbijstrevenden (in het geloof) zullen de eersten zijn,
null.verse 56:11: Dezen zijn de gunstelingen die God dicht zullen naderen.
null.verse 56:13: Het zijn een groot aantal van de eersten.
null.verse 56:15: Op sofa’s doorvlochten met goud en edelgesteenten
null.verse 56:16: Daarop nederliggende, naar elkander toegewend!
null.verse 56:17: Daar zullen jonge mannen onder hen rondgaan die niet zullen verouderen
null.verse 56:18: Met bekers, kannen en kopjes gevuld uit een zilveren bron -
null.verse 56:19: Zij zullen daarvan geen hoofdpijn krijgen noch zullen zij dronken worden -
null.verse 56:20: En met fruit dat zij het liefst hebben -
null.verse 56:21: En met vlees van vogelen dat zij begeren.
null.verse 56:22: En er zullen schonen zijn met grote, mooie ogen,
null.verse 56:24: Als beloning voor hetgeen zij plachten te doen.
null.verse 56:25: Zij zullen daar geen ijdele gesprekken of zondige taal horen,
null.verse 56:27: En zij die rechts zullen staan - hoe (gelukkig) zijn deze die rechts staan!
null.verse 56:28: Zij zullen zich bevinden tussen doornloze lotusbomen
null.verse 56:33: Noch afgesneden, noch verboden,
null.verse 56:35: Voorwaar, Wij hebben dezen tot een wonderligke schepping gemaakt,
null.verse 56:38: Tot degenen aan de rechter kant.
null.verse 56:39: (Behoort) een groot aantal van de eersten (gelovigen).
null.verse 56:40: En een groot aantal uit latere tijden.
null.verse 56:41: De mensen aan de linker kant - hoe (ongelukkig) zijn degenen die aan de linker kant staan!
null.verse 56:42: Te midden van verschroeiende winden en kokend water.
null.verse 56:43: En in de schaduw van zwarte rook,
null.verse 56:44: Noch koel, noch verfrissend.
null.verse 56:45: Voordien waren zij inderdaad in weelde (op aarde),
null.verse 56:46: En volhardden in grote zonde.
null.verse 56:47: En zij plachten te zeggen: "Als wij dood zijn en stof en beenderen zijn geworden, zullen wij inderdaad herrijzen?
null.verse 56:49: Zeg: "Ja, de vroegeren en de lateren
null.verse 56:50: Zullen tezamen worden verzameld op de vastgestelde tijd van een bepaalde Dag.
null.verse 56:51: Dan, o gij, die waart verdwaald en hebt verloochend,
null.verse 56:52: Gij zult.
null.verse 56:53: En zult er uw buik mee vullen,
null.verse 56:54: En daama kokend water drinken,
null.verse 56:55: (Drinkende,) zoals dorstige kamelen drinken,
null.verse 56:56: Dit zal hun onthaal zijn op de Dag des Gerichts.
null.verse 56:57: Wij schiepen u, maar waarom wildet gij deWaarheid niet erkennen?
null.verse 56:58: Zeg mij wat gij verwekt,
null.verse 56:59: Schept gij het of zijn Wij de Schepper er van?
null.verse 56:60: Wij hebben de dood onder u verordend en Wij kunnen niet worden tegengehouden
null.verse 56:61: Om anderen als gij in uw plaats te stellen en u in een toestand te brengen die gij niet kent.
null.verse 56:62: En zeker kent gij de eerste schepping.
null.verse 56:63: Hebt gij gezien wat gij zaait?
null.verse 56:64: Doen Wij het groeien of doet gij dat?
null.verse 56:65: Als Wij het willen, kunnen Wij dat alles tot stof maken, dan blijft gij jammeren.
null.verse 56:67: Meer nog, wij zijn van alles beroofd.
null.verse 56:68: Ziet, het water dat gij drinkt,
null.verse 56:69: Zijt gij het die het uit de wolken nederzendt, of zijn Wij de Zender?
null.verse 56:70: Indien Wij het willen, kunnen Wij het bitter maken.
null.verse 56:71: En zeg mij; het vuur dat gij aansteekt,
null.verse 56:72: Zijt gij het die de boom er voor doet groeien of zijn Wij het?
null.verse 56:73: Wij hebben het tot een aanmaning en een weldaad gemaakt voor de reizigers in de wildernissen.
null.verse 56:74: Daarom verheerlijk de naam van uw Heer, de Verhevene.
null.verse 56:75: En Ik roep het verschieten der sterren tot getuige
null.verse 56:76: En inderdaad is dat een grote eed, indien gij het beseft -;
null.verse 56:79: Dat niemand zal aanraken behalve zij die zich louteren.
null.verse 56:80: Een Openbaring van de Heer der Werelden.
null.verse 56:81: Veracht gij dan deze aankondiging?
null.verse 56:82: En verzekert gij door de ontkenning ervan uw levensonderhoud?
null.verse 56:83: Waarom dan, wanneer de ziel van (de stervende) zijn keel bereikt
null.verse 56:84: En gij ziet toe - op dat ogenblik
null.verse 56:85: Zijn Wij dichter bij hem dan gij, maar gij ziet dit niet,
null.verse 56:86: Waarom dan, als gij niet onderdanig zijt,
null.verse 56:87: Brengt gij haar niet terug indien gij waarachtig zijt?
null.verse 56:88: Als hij nu behoort tot degenen, die dicht bij God zijn,
null.verse 56:89: Dan is voor hem geluk en geur en een tuin van verrukking;
null.verse 56:90: En indien hij behoort tot degenen aan de rechter kant,
null.verse 56:91: Dan luidt het "Vrede zij u" van degenen aan de rechter kant.
null.verse 56:92: Maar als hij behoort tot de dwalenden die (de Waarheid) hadden verloochend,
null.verse 56:93: Dan is voor hem een onthaal op kokend water
null.verse 56:95: Voorzeker dit is de werkelijkheid.
null.verse 56:96: Verheerlijk daarom de naam van uw Heer, de Verhevene.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:2: There is no denying that it will befall -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:4: When the earth is shaken with a shock
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:5: And the hills are ground to powder
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:6: So that they become a scattered dust,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:7: And ye will be three kinds:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:8: (First) those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:9: And (then) those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:10: And the foremost in the race, the foremost in the race:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:11: Those are they who will be brought nigh
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:13: A multitude of those of old
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:14: And a few of those of later time.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:17: There wait on them immortal youths
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:18: With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:19: Wherefrom they get no aching of the head nor any madness,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:21: And flesh of fowls that they desire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:22: And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:24: Reward for what they used to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:25: There hear they no vain speaking nor recrimination
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:26: (Naught) but the saying: Peace, (and again) Peace.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:27: And those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:33: Neither out of reach nor yet forbidden,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:35: Lo! We have created them a (new) creation
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:38: For those on the right hand;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:39: A multitude of those of old
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:40: And a multitude of those of later time.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:41: And those on the left hand: What of those on the left hand ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:42: In scorching wind and scalding water
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:45: Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:46: And used to persist in the awful sin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:47: And they used to say: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:49: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Lo! those of old and those of later time
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:50: Will all be brought together to the tryst of an appointed day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:51: Then lo! ye, the erring, the deniers,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:52: Ye verily will eat of a tree called Zaqqum
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:53: And will fill your bellies therewith;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:54: And thereon ye will drink of boiling water,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:55: Drinking even as the camel drinketh.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:56: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:58: Have ye seen that which ye emit ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:59: Do ye create it or are We the Creator ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:60: We mete out death among you, and We are not to be outrun,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:61: That We may transfigure you and make you what ye know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:62: And verily ye know the first creation.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:63: Have ye seen that which ye cultivate ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:64: Is it ye who foster it, or are We the Fosterer ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:65: If We willed, We verily could make it chaff, then would ye cease not to exclaim:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:66: Lo! we are laden with debt!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:68: Have ye observed the water which ye drink ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:69: Is it ye who shed it from the raincloud, or are We the Shedder ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:70: If We willed We verily could make it bitter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:71: Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:72: Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:73: We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the wilderness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:74: Therefor (O Muhammad), praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:75: Nay, I swear by the places of the stars -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:76: And lo! that verily is a tremendous oath, if ye but knew -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:77: That (this) is indeed a noble Qur’an
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:79: Which none toucheth save the purified,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:80: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:81: Is it this Statement that ye scorn,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:82: And make denial thereof your livelihood ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:83: Why, then, when (the soul) cometh up to the throat (of the dying)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:84: And ye are at that moment looking
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:85: - And We are nearer unto him than ye are, but ye see not -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:86: Why then, if ye are not in bondage (unto Us),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:87: Do ye not force it back, if ye are truthful ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:88: Thus if he is of those brought nigh,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:89: Then breath of life, and plenty, and a Garden of delight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:90: And if he is of those on the right hand,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:91: Then (the greeting) "Peace be unto thee" from those on the right hand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:92: But if he is of the rejecters, the erring,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:93: Then the welcome will be boiling water
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 56:96: Therefor Therefor (O Muhammad) praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:1: When the Event inevitable cometh to pass,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:2: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:3: (Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:4: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:5: And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:7: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:8: Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:9: And the Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:10: And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:11: These will be those Nearest to God:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:13: A number of people from those of old,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:14: And a few from those of later times.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:15: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:16: Reclining on them, facing each other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:17: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:18: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:19: No after-ache will they receive therefrom, nor will they suffer intoxication:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:20: And with fruits, any that they may select:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:21: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:22: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:24: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:25: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:27: The Companions of the Right Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:28: (They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:29: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:33: Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:34: And on Thrones (of Dignity), raised high.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:35: We have created (their Companions) of special creation.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:36: And made them virgin - pure (and undefiled), -
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:38: For the Companions of the Right Hand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:39: A (goodly) number from those of old,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:40: And a (goodly) number from those of later times.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:41: The Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:42: (They will be) in the midst of a Fierce Blast of Fire and in Boiling Water,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:43: And in the shades of Black Smoke:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:44: Nothing (will there be) to refresh, nor to please:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:45: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:46: And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:47: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:49: Say: "Yea, those of old and those of later times,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:50: "All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a Day well-known.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:51: "Then will ye truly,- O ye that go wrong, and treat (Truth) as Falsehood!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:52: "Ye will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:53: "Then will ye fill your insides therewith,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:54: "And drink Boiling Water on top of it:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:55: "Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:56: Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:57: It is We Who have created you: why will ye not witness the Truth?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:58: Do ye then see?- The (human Seed) that ye throw out,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:59: Is it ye who create it, or are We the Creators?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:60: We have decreed Death to be your common lot, and We are not to be frustrated
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:61: from changing your Forms and creating you (again) in (forms) that ye know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:62: And ye certainly know already the first form of creation: why then do ye not celebrate His praises?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:63: See ye the seed that ye sow in the ground?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:64: Is it ye that cause it to grow, or are We the Cause?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:65: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and ye would be left in wonderment,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:66: (Saying), "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:67: "Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:68: See ye the water which ye drink?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:69: Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:70: Were it Our Will, We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:71: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:72: Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:73: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:74: Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:75: Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:76: And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:77: That this is indeed a qur’an Most Honourable,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:79: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:80: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:81: Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:82: And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:83: Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:84: And ye the while (sit) looking on,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:85: But We are nearer to him than ye, and yet see not,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:86: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:87: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:88: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to God,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:89: (There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction, and a Garden of Delights.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:90: And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:91: (For him is the salutation), "Peace be unto thee", from the Companions of the Right Hand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:92: And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood, who go wrong,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:93: For him is Entertainment with Boiling Water.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:95: Verily, this is the Very Truth and Certainly.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 56:96: So celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:4: when the earth shall be rocked
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:7: and you shall be three bands --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:8: Companions of the Right (O Companions of the Right!)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:9: Companions of the Left (O Companions of the Left!)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:11: those are they brought nigh the Throne,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:14: and how few of the later folk)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:16: reclining upon them, set face to face,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:17: immortal youths going round about them
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:18: with goblets, and ewers, and a cup from a spring
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:20: and such fruits as they shall choose,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:21: and such flesh of fowl as they desire,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:23: as the likeness of hidden pearls,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:24: a recompense for that they laboured.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:25: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, no cause of sin,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:27: The Companions of the Right (O Companions of the Right!)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:36: and We made them spotless virgins,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:38: like of age for the Companions of the Right.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:40: and a throng of the later folk.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:41: The Companions of the Left (O Companions of the Left!)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:42: mid burning winds and boiling waters
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:43: and the shadow of a smoking blaze
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:45: and before that they lived at ease,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:46: and persisted in the Great Sin,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:47: ever saying, ’What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised up?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:48: What, and our fathers, the ancients?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:49: Say: ’The ancients, and the later folk
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:50: shall be gathered to the appointed time of a known day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:51: Then you erring ones, you that cried lies,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:52: you shall eat of a tree called Zakkoum,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:53: and you shall fill therewith your bellies
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:54: and drink on top of that boiling water
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:55: lapping it down like thirsty camels.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:56: This shall be their hospitality on the Day of Doom.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:57: We created you; therefore why will you not believe?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:58: Have you considered the seed you spill?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:59: Do you yourselves create it, or are We the Creators?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:60: We have decreed among you Death; We shall not be outstripped;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:61: that We may exchange the likes of you, and make you to grow again in a fashion you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:62: You have known the first growth; so why will you not remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:63: Have you considered the soil you till?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:64: Do you yourselves sow it, or are We the Sowers?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:65: Did We will, We would make it broken orts, and you would remain bitterly jesting --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:68: Have you considered the water you drink?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:69: Did you send it down from the clouds, or did We send it?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:70: Did We will, We would make it bitter; so why are you not thankful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:71: Have you considered the fire you kindle?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:72: Did you make its timber to grow, or did We make it?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:73: We Ourselves made it for a reminder, and a boon to the desert-dwellers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:74: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:75: No! I swear by the fallings of the stars
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:76: (and that is indeed a mighty oath, did you but know it)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:77: it is surely a noble Koran
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:79: none but the purified shall touch,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:80: a sending down from the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:81: What, do you hold this discourse in disdain,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:82: and do you make it your living to cry lies?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:83: Why, but when the soul leaps to the throat of the dying
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:84: and that hour you are watching
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:85: (And We are nigher him than you, but you do not see Us)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:86: why, if you are not at Our disposal,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:87: do you not bring back his soul, if you speak truly?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:88: Then, if he be of those brought nigh the Throne,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:89: there shall be repose and ease, and a Garden of Delight;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:90: and if he be a Companion of the Right:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:91: ’Peace be upon thee, Companion of the Right!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:92: But if he be of them that cried lies, and went astray,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:93: there shall be a hospitality of boiling water
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:95: Surely this is the truth of certainty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 56:96: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.

Muhammad Asad.verse 56:1: WHEN THAT which must come to pass [at last] comes to pass,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:2: there will be nought that could give the lie to its having come to pass,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:5: When the earth is shaken with a shaking ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:6: and the mountains are shattered into
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:8: so that they become as scattered dust –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:9: [on that Day,] then, shall you be [divided into] three kinds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:10: Thus, there shall be such as will have attained to what is right: oh, how
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:11: will be they who have attained to what is right!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:12: And there shall be such as will have lost themselves in evil: oh, how
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:13: will be they who have lost themselves in evil!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:14: But the foremost shall be [they who in life were] the foremost [in faith and good works]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:17: In gardens of bliss [will they dwell] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:18: a good many of those of olden times,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:21: [They will be seated] on gold-encrusted thrones of happiness,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:22: reclining upon them, facing one another [in love].
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:23: Immortal youths will wait upon them
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:24: with goblets, and ewers, and cups filled with water from unsullied springs
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:25: by which their minds will not be clouded and which will not make them drunk;
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:26: and with fruit of any kind that they may choose,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:27: and with the flesh of any fowl that they may desire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:28: And [with them will be their] companions pure, most beautiful of eye,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:31: [And this will be] a reward for what they did [in life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:32: No empty talk will they hear there, nor any call to sin,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:33: but only the tiding of inner soundness and peace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:34: NOW AS FOR those who have attained to righteousness – what of those who have attained to righteousness?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:35: [They, too, will find themselves] amidst fruit-laden lote-trees,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:40: never-failing and never out of reach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:41: And [with them will be their] spouses, raised high:
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:42: for, behold, We shall have brought them into being in a life renewed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:45: with those who have attained to righteousness:
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:46: a good many of olden times,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:47: and a good many of later times.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:48: BUT AS FOR those who have persevered in evil – what of those who have persevered in evil?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:49: [They will find themselves] in the midst of scorching winds, and burning despair,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:50: and the shadows of black smoke –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:53: For, behold, in times gone by they were wont to abandon themselves wholly to the pursuit of pleasures,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:54: and would persist in heinous sinning,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:55: and would say, "What! After we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:56: and perhaps, too, our forebears of old?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:57: Say: "Verily, those of olden times and those of later times
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:58: will indeed be gathered together at an appointed time on a Day known [only to God]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:59: and then, verily, O you who have gone astray and called the truth a lie,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:60: you will indeed have to taste of the tree of deadly fruit,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:61: and will have to fill your bellies therewith,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:62: and will thereupon have to drink [many a draught] of burning despair –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:63: drink it as the most insatiably thirsty camels drink!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:64: Such will be their welcome on Judgment Day!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:65: IT IS WE who have created you, [O men:] why, then, do you not accept the truth?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:68: Is it you who create it – or are We the source of its creation?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:71: among you: but there is nothing to prevent Us
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:72: from changing the nature of your existence and bringing you into being
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:73: in a manner [as yet] unknown to you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:75: you are indeed aware of the [miracle of your] coming into being in the first instance – why, then, do you not bethink yourselves [of Us]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:76: Have you ever considered the seed which you cast upon the soil?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:77: Is it you who cause it to grow – or are We the cause of its growth?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:79: were it Our will, We could indeed turn it into chaff, and you would be left to wonder [and to lament],
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:81: Nay, but we have been deprived [of our livelihood]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:82: Have you ever considered the water which you drink?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:83: Is it you who cause it to come down from the clouds – or are We the cause of its coming down?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:84: [It comes down sweet – but] were it Our will, We could make it burningly salty and bitter: why, then, do you not give thanks [unto Us]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:85: Have you ever considered the fire which you kindle?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:86: Is it you who have brought into being the tree that serves as its fuel – or are We the cause of its coming into being?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:87: It is We who have made it a means to remind [you of Us], and a comfort for all who are lost and hungry in the wilderness [of their lives].
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:88: Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer’s mighty name!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:89: NAY, I call to witness the coming-down in parts [of this Qur’ān] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:90: and, behold, this is indeed a most solemn affirmation, if you but knew it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:91: Behold, it is a truly noble discourse,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:92: [conveyed unto man] in a well-guarded divine writ
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:93: which none but the pure [of heart] can touch:
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:94: a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:95: Would you, now, look down with disdain on a tiding like this,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:96: and make it your daily bread [as it were] to call the truth a lie?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:97: Why, then, when [the last breath] comes up to the throat [of a dying man],
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:100: and while We are closer to him than you, although you see
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:102: why, then, if [you think that] you are not truly dependent [on Us],
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:103: can you not cause that [ebbing life] to return – if what you claim is true?
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:104: [ALL OF YOU are destined to die.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:105: happiness [awaits him in the life to come], and inner fulfilment, and a garden of bliss.
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:106: And if one happens to be of those who have attained to righteousness,
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:107: [he, too, will be welcomed into paradise with the words,] "Peace be unto thee [that art] of those who have attained to righteousness!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:108: But if one happens to be of those who are wont to call the truth a lie, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:110: a welcome of burning despair [awaits him in the life to come,]
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:111: and the heat of a blazing fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:112: Verily, this is indeed the truth of truths!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:113: Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer’s mighty name!
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:114: those toothless old women of yours whom God will resurrect as new beings” (Al-Hasan, as quoted by Rāzī in his comments on 44:54).
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:115: of equal age” (a meaning adopted by most of the commentators); however, as pointed out by all philological authorities, this term is also used in the sense of “
Muhammad Asad.verse 56:116: equal in quality,” that is, “well-matched”: a significance which, to my mind, is eminently appropriate here inasmuch as it is meant to stress the equal excellence of all who have attained to righteousness, whether they be men or women; or, alternatively, the equal attraction towards one another and, thus, a mutual fulfilment of their spiritual and emotional needs; or both of the above meanings.

Martin Lings.verse 56:3: It is they who are brought nigh.
Martin Lings.verse 56:4: who are brought near to God.
Martin Lings.verse 56:5: are those who are brought near.
Martin Lings.verse 56:6: A multitude of those of old.
Martin Lings.verse 56:11: And a few of those of the later time.
Martin Lings.verse 56:14: few amongst the later generations And
Martin Lings.verse 56:16: Therein (in Paradise) hear they no vain word, nor any incitement to sin.
Martin Lings.verse 56:17: (in the Garden of Paradise) they shall hear no idle speaking nor any incitement to evil.
Martin Lings.verse 56:18: hear no vain talk or incitement to evil.
Martin Lings.verse 56:24: A multitude of those of old.
Martin Lings.verse 56:28: And a multitude of those of later time.
Martin Lings.verse 56:33: Verily this is an all-bountiful recitation.
Martin Lings.verse 56:37: Which none toucheth save the purified.
Martin Lings.verse 56:39: A revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
Martin Lings.verse 56:41: We are nearer to him than ye are, although ye see not.
